bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Edwin F. Uhl
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.note: Index Bureau Dept of State Received May 10 94
div1.ab:
Consulate-General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, March 31, 1894.

Mr. Beverly Y. Payne,
To the Department of State.
div1.p: Accounts and returns for the quarter ending March 31, 1894
div1.ab:
Consulate-General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, March 31, 1894.

Honorable Edwin F. Uhl,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D. C.
div1.p: I have the honor to transmit herewith, the Accounts and returns of this Consulate General for the quarter ending March 31, 1894, as per subjoined list of inclosures.

I have the honor to be,
Sir:
Your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne,
U.S. Vice Consul.

1. Summary of Business
2. Record of Notarial Services
3. Record of Treasury Fees
4. Abstract of Contingent Expenses,
5. General Quarterly Account & Certificate of nonobsence,
6. Vouchers (3)
